de.kpelz.jstruct.main

Class JStruct

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.kpelz.jstruct.main.JStruct

  • public class JStruct
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Konstantin Pelz

    Equivalence to struct in Python. This plugin converts C structs into Java values and vica versa.

    Byte Order, Size & Alignment
    Character Byte order Size Alignment
    @ native native native
    = native standard none
    < little-endian standard none
    > big-endian standard none
    ! network (=big-endian) standard none
    '@' is currently not supported. Please use '<' or '>'.

    Format Characters
    Format C Type Java Type Standard size
    x pad byte
    c char char 1
    b signed char int 1
    B unsigned char int 1
    ? _Bool boolean 1
    h short int 2
    H unsigned short int 2
    i int int 4
    I unsigned int int 4
    l long int 4
    L unsigned long long 4
    q long long long 8
    Q unsigned long long no support 8
    n ssize_t no support
    N size_t no support
    e half-precision float no support
    f float float 4
    d double double 8
    s char[] String
    p char[] String
    P void * no support

    • Constructor Detail

      • JStruct

        public JStruct(java.lang.String format)
        throws JStruct.JStructException
        Constructor for JStruct
        Parameters:
        format - of the JStruct
        Throws:
        JStruct.JStructException - thrown if format is invalid or format starts with an '@'

    • Method Detail

      • pack

        public byte[] pack(java.lang.Object... values)
            throws JStruct.JStructException
        Packs values into a byte array. The type of each value have to match the type of the belonging format character. For matching types see the table 'Format Characters' in JStruct.
        Parameters:
        values - to pack
        Returns:
        byte array with the values packed as bytes
        Throws:
        JStruct.JStructException

      • packInto

        public void packInto(byte[] buffer,
                     int offset,
                     java.lang.Object... values)
              throws JStruct.JStructException
        Packs values into buffer starting at offset.
        Parameters:
        buffer - to pack into the values as bytes
        offset - should not be null
        values - to pack
        Throws:
        JStruct.JStructException
